grammarNote.title: そうだ: Hearsay
grammarNote.explanation:
A new pattern appears: 友達がくるそうだ — friends are coming, I hear. 降るそうだ — it will rain, they say. きたそうだ — [someone] came, apparently.

そうだ attaches to a whole clause and means 'I hear that.' This is different from the そう you learned early on (which means 'that's right').

眠るのはまだだめだ — sleeping is still not allowed. The の pattern continues alongside the new そうだ.

Re-read and find every そうだ. What is reported?
